questions.question: The injured ............................... to hospital.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is made by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The conference .......................................... by 200 delegates.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is made by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb. Conference is a singular countable noun hence we use the verb was.

questions.question: The car .............................................. at the moment.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions or situations that are going on at the moment of speaking. In the present continuous tense, the passive form is made by putting is/am/are + being before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The boy ............................................... for cheating on the exam.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is made by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The startup .......................................... by a German company.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, the passive form is made by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The results ................................................ yesterday.
questions.description: The present perfect cannot be used with past time expressions.

questions.question: She ............................................  to leave.
questions.description: Since there is no time expression either the simple past or the present perfect is possible here.
